VR experience to stimulate physical activity

VR games offer an engaging and motivating approach to stimulate physical activity in Multiple Sclerosis (MS) patients during rehabilitation, ultimately helping to improve their quality of life.

Find Out More

Discover the Power of Virtual Reality!

Virtual Reality (VR) is an innovative technology that transports users into computer-generated simulations, creating immersive and interactive environments. By wearing a VR headset, individuals can escape to a whole new world that feels remarkably real and lifelike. Through the clever use of visual, auditory, and tactile cues, VR has the incredible ability to simulate a wide range of sensory experiences, offering a powerful illusion of presence in another realm.

In recent years, VR has gained immense popularity as a versatile tool for entertainment, education, and therapy. It has proven to be particularly beneficial for patients with various conditions, including Multiple Sclerosis (MS). At the MS Center, we harness the potential of VR technology to revolutionize rehabilitation through virtual reality therapy.

Our mission is to empower MS patients to improve their cognitive and physical abilities using the captivating realm of virtual reality. Our carefully crafted VR games are designed to not only challenge but also engage patients in a safe and enjoyable manner. Every step of the way, our experienced healthcare professionals are dedicated to providing unwavering support and guidance.

VR Games



Hub



Upon entering the VR world, the player will find themselves on a serene, deserted island. A mysterious and sacred text awaits them, outlining the objective of the game. The player must locate and enter three portals scattered across the island. Inside these portals, they will face challenging activities designed to stimulate movement and engage their motor skills. Upon successful completion of each activity, the player can return to the island, where new opportunities and adventures await.

Training



In this immersive training module, the player is transported to a specially designed room. Here, a series of interactive instructions appear, guiding the player through movements that are specifically meant to stimulate their physical abilities. The VR system tracks the movements of the player's controllers, ensuring that the instructions are effectively carried out. This training serves as a foundation for the subsequent activities, helping the player improve their coordination and range of motion.

Swimming


Dive into an underwater adventure where the player is randomly placed in a captivating aquatic environment. The objective is to navigate through the depths and find a way back to the island. However, obstacles in the form of playful yet challenging flocks of fish impede the player's progress. By mimicking a swimming motion with their hands, the player can explore the virtual seas and overcome the fishy hindrances. This activity promotes upper body movement and coordination.

Rowing



Get ready for an exciting rowing experience in the vast ocean surrounding the island. The player begins on a small boat, tasked with reaching the nearest visible island. To propel the boat forward, the player must perform a rowing motion using the VR controllers. By simulating the physical act of rowing, this activity engages the player's upper body muscles, improving their strength and motor skills.
